bibl.title: Greek Lyric. V. The New School of Poetry and Anonymous Songs and Hymns.
bibl.note: This final volume includes the fragments, mainly dithyrambic, of the 'New School' of poets who composed in the late fifth and early fourth centuries, together with folk songs, drinking songs (scolia) and other anonymous pieces.
bibl.seg: CAMPBELL David A. (Edited and Translated by), Greek Lyric. V. The New School of Poetry and Anonymous Songs and Hymns. (The Loeb Classical Library. 144.)
Cambridge, Mass. - London, Harvard University Press, 1993, 8Â°, [x]-482 pp. ISBN 0-674-99559-7.

This final volume includes the fragments, mainly dithyrambic, of the 'New School' of poets who composed in the late fifth and early fourth centuries, together with folk songs, drinking songs (scolia) and other anonymous pieces.

C.R. par Dominique Arnould, REA 97 (1995) p. 650. - Philippe Brunet, REG 107 (1994) p. 741. - Daniel Donnet, AntCl 64 (1995) pp. 282-283. - S.R. Slings, Mnemosyne 4a s., 48 (1995) pp. 469-473 [concerne aussi: vol. IV, 1992]. - Martin L. West, CR N.S., 45 (1995) pp. 11-13. - Francisca Pordomingo, Emerita 65 (1997) pp. 126-128.
